availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Howell Crawford (Louisville real estate agent and politician)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky real estate agent and politician. Rockbridge County, Virginia native. Son of Thomas Crawford and Jane Todd Crawford. Married Clementine E. Crawford. City assessor of Louisville in 1850. Know-Nothing Party Louisville Board of Alderman from 1857 to 1858. President of the Louisville Board of Alderman in 1858. Mayor of Louisville from 1859 to 1861. Unsuccessful Union Party candidate for Mayor of Louisville in 1863.

bibl.p: “Crawford, Thomas Howell,” in The Encyclopedia of Louisville, ed. John E. Kleber (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 2015), p. 230. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 7, District 4, p. 359. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 7, District 4, p. 872. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 7, p. 75.
